title.value: Determinants of technology adoption and continued use among cognitively impaired older adults: a qualitative study
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper, indicating the focus of the study on technology adoption among cognitively impaired older adults.
title.quote: Determinants of technology adoption and continued use among cognitively impaired older adults: a qualitative study

extractions.description: The paper explores the factors that affect the adoption and continued use of technology by older adults with mild cognitive impairments. It employs qualitative methods, including interviews and a focus group, to gather data from different perspectives. The study identifies themes around technology introduction and determinants of adoption and continued use, emphasizing the role of individual, technological, and contextual factors.

type.justification: The study involves collecting and analyzing data from participants to identify patterns and themes related to technology use among older adults with cognitive impairments.
type.quote: This study used a multi-source generic qualitative design... We used thematic analysis with an inductive approach to identify and select themes from the data.

name.justification: The paper focuses on technology adoption by cognitively impaired older adults, which relates to aging and geriatrics.
name.quote: This study aimed to bridge this gap in research by examining the factors underlying technology use in community-dwelling older adults with mild cognitive impairments.

name.justification: The research discusses the use of technology to aid older adults, aligning with the field of gerontechnology.
name.quote: These technologies are sometimes referred to as e-Health technologies or gerontechnologies.
